THE CITY OF PHILADELPHIA      Re: Mayor's Office - Philly Mayor Fair Workweek comments    Your receipt number is: 28977  Dear 170869-56579309@requests. muckrock. com, 
   
 Thank you for your correspondence.  This is an automatic email confirming that your correspondence has been entered into our case management system for processing and response. If you have an additional request you wish to file, or if you wish to make a change to a pending request, please email it directly to righttoknowlaw@.phila.gov.     Did you know that the City already releases a lot of information and open data online?  You might be able to find the answer to your inquiry right now!   
   
 
Here are some common types of requests we receive and where to find this information online right now:  
 
 Search for a property's L&I related permits, licenses, violations, and appeals with the L&I property history tool.  
 
 Search for a property's Real Estate Tax Balance with the Revenue Department's tax real estate lookup tool.  
 
 Find all of the City of Philadelphia's open data sets, including City employee salary data, on Open Data Philly, the Philadelphia region's open data portal.  
 
 Search information about professional service contracts online at eContract Philly.  
 
 Search information about procurement contracts online with PHL Contracts.  
 
 Search City legislation and related hearings online with Legistar.  
 
 Obtain financial disclosure forms from the Department of Records.  
 
 
   If you seek a police incident report, you can obtain the proper form from the Department of Records.  Please note that police incident reports cost $25.      If you seek audio, visual, or bodycam records from the Philadelphia Police Department, you will need to make a request following the instructions in 42 Pa.C.S.A. Sec. 67A03 at https://www.legis.state.pa.us/cfdocs/legis/LI/consCheck.cfm?txtType=HTM&ttl=42&div=0&chpt=67A. Such requests must be made in-person or via 
certified mail following the instructions in 42 Pa.C.S.A. §  67A(3) (aka
 Act 22). Such requests are not processed under the RTKL. See 42 Pa.C.S.A. § 67A(2)(a); 65 P.S. §§ 67.305, 67.3101.1. You may use this form to make a request under Act 22. Requests under Act 22  should be addressed to: Lieutenant Barry Jacobs, Philadelphia Police Department, Open Records/Right to Know Section, Philadelphia Public Services Building, 400 N. Broad St., 4W-72, Philadelphia, PA 19130. Such requests are not processed under the Right-to-Know Law.       Use the forms on this page to request copies of various public safety from the Department of Records, such as:   
 Traffic Accident Reports (aka "crash report" - also available through https://public-safety-reports.phila.gov/)  A records check or letter of good conduct from the Philadelphia Police Department  Fire Reports  Emergency Medical Services Reports       The City of Philadelphia does not process Right-to-Know requests for the organizations listed below.  If you want to submit a request to one of these entities, please click the links below to be directed to their Open Records Policies:   
 
Philadelphia Parking Authority  
 
 
School District of Philadelphia  
 
 
City of Philadelphia District Attorney’s Office  
 
 
Philadelphia Redevelopment Authority  
 
 
First Judicial District (Philadelphia Court of Common Pleas)  
 
 
   If one of these sources has solved your inquiry, please let us know!  Otherwise, thank you for your patience, and we will be in touch soon.   Sincerely,   The City of Philadelphia  Please Note: To help make sure that future emails from us don't end up in your spam or junk folder, please add this email address to your safe sender list.

communications.subject: Re: Mayor's Office - Philly Mayor Fair Workweek comments
communications.communication:
CITY OF PHILADELPHIA  LAW DEPARTMENT One Parkway Building 1515 Arch Street Philadelphia, PA 19102  Renee Garcia  City Solicitor   BY EMAIL: 170869-56579309@requests.muckrock.com Re: Mayor's Office - Philly Mayor Fair Workweek comments Request #: 28977  Dear Peter Fugiel:  Thank you for writing to the City of Philadelphia (City) with your request for information. This correspondence serves as an acknowledgement and receipt of your request as well as notice of the City’s Open Records Policy pursuant to the Right-to-Know Law.  Written requests for records to state and local agencies in Pennsylvania are generally governed by the Commonwealth’s Right-to-Know Law (RTKL), 65 P.S. §§ 67.101-67.3104. In accordance with the RTKL, the City has promulgated an Open Records Policy, which requires the standard statewide Right-to-Know Form be used for the submission of written requests pursuant to the RTKL. See 65 P.S. § 67.504(a); Dekok v. Lancaster County, AP 2010-1197, 2011 PA O.O.R.D. LEXIS 25 at *5 and n.1 (Pa. O.O.R. Jan. 17, 2011) (holding that in accordance with the RTKL, an agency may adopt a policy requiring the use of the standard statewide form established by the Office of Open Records in order to file a RTK Request); accord Pa. Gaming Control Bd. v. Office of Open Records, 48 A.3d 503 (Pa. Cmmw. 2012). As your request was not submitted on or with the standard statewide form, the City does not consider your request to be a Right-to-Know Request pursuant to the RTKL and will process it as an informal request.  You do not have to resubmit your request for the City to respond unless you are specifically informed otherwise. The City reserves the right to require a formal RTK Request be submitted pursuant to the RTKL before releasing records. The City is continuing to process the request you have submitted as an informal request outside the RTKL and will be in touch with you further to respond to your request.  However, if you would like to file a RTK Request, please submit your request on or with the standard statewide Right-to-Know Form and email your request to righttoknowlaw@phila.gov – please do not reply to this email. Please include this notice with your RTK Request. Please note that if you resubmit your request as a written request pursuant to the RTKL, the City will deem your informal request to have been withdrawn.   The City’s Open Records Policy can be found here:   https://www.phila.gov/open-records-policy/   The statewide form appears at the end of the City’s Open Records Policy. If you require a hard copy of the form and/or policy, please let me know and one will be provided.  The City reserves the right to assert any and all grounds of denial in its final response to your request.  Respectfully,     Feige Grundman  Chief Deputy City Solicitor  Right to Know Unit  City of Philadelphia Law Department    Tracking #: Fugiel 28977 Request Summary: All written communications received by the Mayor's Office from lobbyists or the general public during the period 1/1/2018–12/31/2018 concerning the Fair Workweek Law (File No. 180649). The requested records include written testimony, comments, letters, or emails addressed to former Mayor Kenney or his Deputies. Original Request:   
  
   
 
 
 
 
From:
170869-56579309@requests.muckrock.com <170869-56579309@requests.muckrock.com>

communications.subject: RTK Request for Mayor's Fair Workweek Communications
communications.communication:
Dear Public Records Officer,

Please find attached a Right to Know Request for written communications
received by the Mayor's Office from lobbyists or the general public during
the period 1/1/2018–12/31/2018 concerning the Fair Workweek Law (File No.
180649). Please note that I am using the MuckRock website to manage this
request and ensure that any records released are available to the general
public. A previous version of this request (#28977) was deemed "informal"
because it used an outdated version of the request form. I am now
submitting a standard request form for the same records under the
Pennsylvania Right to Know Law.

I am requesting these records for non-commercial research purposes. I would
prefer that the request be filled electronically, if possible, by e-mail
attachment. In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you
would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I
look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business
days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

*Peter Fugiel, PhD* | Postdoctoral Research Fellow

Department of Labor Studies and Employment Relations

Rutgers School of Management and Labor Relations

communications.subject: Fwd: Mayor's Office - All Mayor's Fair Workweek Communications
communications.communication:
---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: City of Philadelphia Right to Know <righttoknow@phila.gov>
Date: Fri, Aug 9, 2024 at 4:03 PM
Subject: Mayor's Office - All Mayor's Fair Workweek Communications
To: <peter.fugiel@rutgers.edu>



THE CITY OF PHILADELPHIA

Re: Mayor's Office - All Mayor's Fair Workweek Communications

*Your receipt number is:* 29069

Dear Peter Fugiel,

Thank you for your correspondence. This is an automatic email confirming
that your correspondence has been entered into our case management system
for processing and response. If you have an additional request you wish to
file, or if you wish to make a change to a pending request, please email it
directly to righttoknowlaw@.phila.gov.


*D**id you know that the City already releases a lot of information and
open data online? You might be able to find the answer to your inquiry
right now!*

Here are some common types of requests we receive and where to find this
information online right now:

   - Search for a property's L&I related permits, licenses, violations, and
   appeals with the L&I property history tool <http://li.phila.gov/>.
   - Search for a property's Real Estate Tax Balance with the Revenue
   Department's tax real estate lookup tool
   <http://www.phila.gov/revenue/RealEstateTax/>.
   - Find all of the City of Philadelphia's open data sets, including City
   employee salary data, on Open Data Philly
   <https://www.opendataphilly.org/>, the Philadelphia region's open data
   portal.
   - Search information about professional service contracts online at
eContract
   Philly <https://secure.phila.gov/eContract/>.
   - Search information about procurement contracts online with PHL
   Contracts <https://www.phlcontracts.phila.gov/bso/>.
   - Search City legislation and related hearings online with Legistar
   <https://phila.legistar.com/>.
   - Obtain financial disclosure forms from the Department of Records
   <http://fdswebsearch.phila-records.com/Default.aspx>.


If you seek a police incident report, you can obtain the proper form from
the Department of Records
<http://www.phila.gov/records/PoliceFire/Reports.html>. Please note that
police incident reports cost $25.

If you seek audio, visual, or bodycam records from the Philadelphia Police
Department, you will need to make a request following the instructions
in 42 Pa.C.S.A. Sec. 67A03 at
https://www.legis.state.pa.us/cfdocs/legis/LI/consCheck.cfm?txtType=HTM&ttl=42&div=0&chpt=67A.
Such requests must be made in-person or via certified mail following the
instructions in 42 Pa.C.S.A. §  67A(3) (aka Act 22). Such requests are not
processed under the RTKL. See 42 Pa.C.S.A. § 67A(2)(a); 65 P.S. §§ 67.305,
67.3101.1. You may use this form
<https://www.openrecords.pa.gov/Documents/RTKL/Act22_RequestForm.pdf> to
make a request under Act 22. Requests under Act 22  should be addressed to:
Lieutenant Barry Jacobs, Philadelphia Police Department, Open Records/Right
to Know Section, Philadelphia Public Services Building, 400 N. Broad St.,
4W-72, Philadelphia, PA 19130. Such requests are not processed under the
Right-to-Know Law.

Use the forms on this page
<https://www.phila.gov/services/crime-law-justice/get-a-copy-of-a-public-safety-report/>
<https://www.phila.gov/documents/public-safety-report-request-forms/> to
request copies of various public safety from the Department of Records,
such as:

   - Traffic Accident Reports (aka "crash report" - also available through
   https://public-safety-reports.phila.gov/)
   - A records check or letter of good conduct from the Philadelphia Police
   Department
   - Fire Reports
   - Emergency Medical Services Reports


*The City of Philadelphia does not process Right-to-Know requests for the
organizations listed below.* If you want to submit a request to one of
these entities, please click the links below to be directed to their Open
Records Policies:

   - Philadelphia Parking Authority
   <http://philapark.org/wp-content/uploads/2013/09/PPA-RTKL-Policy-June-2013.pdf>

   - School District of Philadelphia
   <https://www.philasd.org/generalcounsel/programsservices/right-to-know-law/>

   - City of Philadelphia District Attorney’s Office
   <http://www.phila.gov/districtattorney/aboutus/Pages/RightToKnow.aspx>
   - Philadelphia Redevelopment Authority
   <https://www.philadelphiaredevelopmentauthority.org/right-know>
   - First Judicial District (Philadelphia Court of Common Pleas)
   <https://www.courts.phila.gov/publicaccess/>


*If one of these sources has solved your inquiry, please let us know!*
Otherwise, thank you for your patience, and we will be in touch soon.

Sincerely,

The City of Philadelphia

*Please Note*: To help make sure that future emails from us don't end up in
your spam or junk folder, please add this email address to your safe sender
list.

Dear Feige Grundman and Right to Know Law Unit,

I am writing to inquire into a Right to Know request I submitted for
written communications received by the Mayor's Office concerning the Fair
Workweek Law (File No. 180649). The request, submitted on August 2, 2024,
was acknowledged on August 9 in receipt #29069. The City asserted its right
to an additional 30 calendar days to review the request. More than 60 days
have passed and I would like to know when I might receive the requested
records.

Please note that I am using the MuckRock website to manage this request and
ensure that any records released are available to the general public.
Request history available at:
https://www.muckrock.com/foi/philadelphia-211/philly-mayor-fair-workweek-comments-170869/
.

Thank you,

*Peter Fugiel, PhD*

communications.subject: Re: Mayor's Office - All Mayor's Fair Workweek Communications
communications.communication: Re: Mayor's Office - All Mayor's Fair Workweek Communications received during 2018    Request #: 29069     Dear Peter Fugiel:    Thank you for your outreach. My apologies for any inconvenience caused by the lapse in response to your request.    At this point in time, your request has been "deemed denied" by operation of law, pursuant to Section 902 of the Right to Know Law.  See 65 P.S. § 67.902.    That being said, the City is currently processing your request, and expects to issue its response on or before May 15, 2025.  Please let me know if you are amenable to this.  You may, but are not required to, file a new formal Right to Know request for the same records, if you wish to avail yourself of any statutory response timeframes or appeal rights.  See City of Phila. Open Records Policy; 65 P.S. § 67.504(a).     Please feel free to reply to me directly with any questions regarding the status of your request.  Respectfully,     Shea Skinner (he/him)    Deputy City Solicitor, Right-to-Know  City of Philadelphia Law Department    1515 Arch Street, 15th floor     Philadelphia, PA 19102

Respectfully,  Shea Skinner (he/him)    Deputy City Solicitor, Right-to-Know  City of Philadelphia Law Department    1515 Arch Street, 15th floor     Philadelphia, PA 19102        See the following link for additional information and resources:  https://linktr.ee/phillylaw

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the North Dakota Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

All documentation submitted to the U.S. Department of Education's Student Privacy Policy Office in response to the office's March 28, 2025, request for records such as "'reports, information on policies and procedures, annual notifications, training materials or other information necessary' to provide assurance that the SEA and their respective LEAs are complying with the provisions of FERPA and PPRA".

I have attached a copy of the SPPO's request letter for reference. The relevant section is found on the last page, under "Assurance of Compliance". The SPPO requested the documentation be submitted no later than April 30, 2025. If the North Dakota Department of Public Instruction sent communications to the SPPO requesting an extension or declining to submit the documentation, I request a copy of said communications.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Ileana Garnand

title: Medical Policies for Blood Borne Pathogens (Maricopa County Sheriff)

communications.subject: Arizona Public Records Law Request: Medical Policies for Blood Borne Pathogens (Maricopa County Sheriff)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Arizona Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

1- Any directives, regulations, manuals, memos, or other training materials given to all staff—both medical and correctional—related to handling or managing prisoners with blood borne pathogens including but not limited Hepatitis C or HIV/AIDS.  This could be in the form of training materials on how to quarantine individuals with blood borne pathogens, or training materials for correctional staff on what to do when coming into contact with someone who has a blood borne pathogen. 

2- Any emergency preparedness manuals, directives, or training materials for when a viral outbreak occurs (this could also be referred to as a “pandemic procedure".)

3- Any medical directives, memos, regulations, or staff training around prescribing the medical protocol of PrEP (pre-exposure prophylaxis).

4- Any directives, regulations, manuals, memos, or other training materials given to staff on housing criteria for specific populations (e.g. women, youth, those with illnesses, etc.)

5- Employee handbook given to correctional staff upon hiring, as well as any employee handbook given separately to medical staff

I am also requesting the following data and forms:

1- Aggregate data by month on the number of prisoners with HIV and Hep C for the last two years. If this data exists only in a format that requires creation of a new record, please provide the data in its original format and remove identifying information.

2- A copy of the standard medical intake form used for prisoners or people held inside the facility.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Joseph Darius Jaafari

communications.subject: RE: Arizona Public Records Law Request: Medical Policies for Blood Borne Pathogens (Maricopa County Sheriff) 2111
communications.communication:
Good morning,

The Maricopa County Sheriff’s Office has received your request for public records and is processing your request. All requests are processed in the order in which they are received, and no requests are prioritized by deadline date. The amount of time to completely process your request depends upon the number of pending requests, volume of material encompassed in the request, and the amount of redaction, if any, that is necessary.

Please be aware, if you are requesting records with large amount of body camera videos and or high-profile cases, the time to complete your request may be significantly longer as these cases are often voluminous. Identifying the specific record(s) being requested may help expedite your request. You will be notified once records are made available for you to download or pick up, or if no records are found. Your tracking # is 2111. When checking the status of your request, please send emails to mediarequest@mcso.maricopa.gov and include your tracking #.

***Pursuant to ARS 39-129, the Maricopa County Sheriff’s Office (MCSO) Legal Liaison Section has implemented a fee schedule for requests for video recordings.  The fee for processing video recordings is $25 per each video-hour ($6.25 per quarter hour).  In the event there are contemporaneous multiple requests for the same video, the cost associated with processing the video will be shared equally between all requesting parties at that time. Requests for previously processed videos will be at no cost unless the requestor wishes to receive a hard copy instead of an electronic copy. Fees for hardcopies are listed below. ***

The fee breakdown for hard copies are as follows:

Documents:                       $.50 for each page

CD’s:                                      $15.00 each


Thank you

communications.subject: RE: Arizona Public Records Law Request #2111 complete
communications.communication:
Good morning,

Your records are available and can be downloaded HERE<https://mcso.sharefile.com/d-s2a0866037dee43c1ab2eeae4fcf16483> for free for the next ten (10) business days. Once you click on the link you will need to input your name and email address to access the records. The link will automatically expire in 10 business days and files are deleted. If you fail to download these files, you will need to resubmit a new request to obtain copies. If you would like a hard copy, please respond to this email and an appointment will be set up for purchasing.

Below is the process and fee associated with requesting hard copies.

Hard copies will be available only by appointments only. Monday through Friday from 9 a.m. to 4 p.m., excluding holidays.  Your records will be available for review or purchase for the next 30 business days from the date of this notice. A price will be provided if you choose to receive hard copies.

Your records can be picked up at the Sheriff’s Office headquarters at 550 W. Jackson, Phoenix AZ 85003. By appointment only.

Items released:

  *   Policy

  *   CP-6 Bloodborne Pathogens
  *   DL-1 Inmate Laundry Services
  *   DQ-1 Inmate Access to Healthcare & Mental Health Services
  *   DQ-2 Medical Isolation
  *   GJ-11 Serious Illness, Injury or Death of a Prisoner or Inmate

  *   Training

  *   CP-6 Bloodborne Pathogens
  *   Hazardous Body Fluid Exposure Guide
  *   HIV Post Exposure Prevention Process
  *   OSHA

Please be advised that you may want to contact Correction Health Services in regards to your request for medical data and forms.


The fee breakdown for hard copies are as follows:

Documents:                       $.50 for each page

CD’s:                                      $15.00 each

*Please Note: Documents are available for 30 business days from the date of this notice to be picked up and/or reviewed.  After 30 business days has elapsed, the request will be closed, and the documents destroyed.  In order to obtain requested documents after the 30 business days, a new public records request will have to be resubmitted and reprocessed.  All requests are handled in the order they are received. Since records are being provided, we will be closing out this file on our end. Thank you

title: Third Party Investigative Platform (Purchase and Contract records)

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Third Party Investigative Platform (Purchase and Contract records)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the records listed below regarding the following four software programs: 

• Thompson Reuters Clear (https://legal.thomsonreuters.com/en/products/clear)
• LexisNexis Accurint (https://www.accurint.com/)
• TransUnion TLOxp, which may also be part of the TruLookup system (https://www.tlo.com/law-enforcement)
• SoundThinking CrimeTracer, which was formerly a product called COPLINK X (https://www.soundthinking.com/law-enforcement/crime-analysis-crimetracer/) from the company formerly known as ShotSpotter

For each of the above mentioned platforms, please provide the following records: 

• CONTRACTS AND AGREEMENTS —  All contracts (as well as associated amendments, attachments, and exhibits) and agreements related to the acquisition and use of these "software" programs.
• PURCHASE INFORMATION — All invoices and purchase information for costs and products associated with the above-referenced platforms.

Please provide responsive materials for the period from January 1, 2021 through the date this request is processed. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Caesar Andrews

communications.subject: Confirmation - P-2025-756 (City of Federal Way Police Department - Police Records)
communications.communication:
Dear Caesar Andrews, 
 The City of Federal Way Police Department has received your request Request Number: P-2025-756 (security key 8A07C5B8) and we look forward to assisting you with your public records search. 
 This request will be assigned to staff who will begin the process of seeking out responsive documents and determining, based on volume, any costs associated with satisfying your request. Per the Revised Code of Washington (RCW) 42.56.520 you will receive a response within five (5) working days which will be one of the following: 
 Providing the record(s); 
 Providing a link to the records posted on the City website; 
 Providing a reasonable estimate of time the City will require to respond to the request; 
 Seeking clarification of the request; or 
 Denying the request [per RCW 42.56.520(4)]. 
 PLEASE NOTE: The State of Washington Public Records Act found in the Revised Code of Washington (RCW) Chapter 42.56 does not require a governmental agency to create new information, to do legal research, or to answer questions. 
 You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you will receive an email when your request has been completed. Again, thank you for using the City of Federal Way Public Records Request Center. 
 Sincerely, 
 Police Records

title: Executive Order 14185 ("Restoring America's Fighting Force") Report on DEI initiatives

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Executive Order 14185 ("Restoring America's Fighting Force") Report on DEI initiatives
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

This request concerns Executive Order 14185 ("Restoring America’s Fighting Force"), available at https://www.federalregister.gov/documents/2025/02/03/2025-02181/restoring-americas-fighting-force. I request a copy of the report required by Section 5 of the Executive Order, which provides: "Department of Defense Internal Review.  The Secretary of Defense shall conduct an internal review that documents actions taken in pursuit of DEI initiatives, including all instances of race and sex discrimination and activities designed to promote a race- or sex-based preferences system.  The report shall be delivered to the Secretary of Defense within 90 days of the date of this order."

That report was due on or before April 27, 2025.

REQUEST FOR EXPEDITED PROCESSING:

I request that this request be expedited under 32 CFR § 286.8(e)(1)(i)(B) for the following reasons:

1. I certify the following to be true and correct: My organization is primarily engaged in disseminating information. The Foundation for Individual Rights and Expression (FIRE) maintains a news website at https://thefire.org/news, through which its staff members regularly publish news stories and editorial content concerning the activities of governments, government officials, and other persons or organizations of public concern. I am a staff member of FIRE. I frequently write about matters involving the First Amendment and press freedom, including on FIRE's website. See, e.g., https://www.thefire.org/news-archive?author=303. A substantial component of my duties as a staff member of FIRE is to obtain information through public records requests, including through the Freedom of Information Act, which I or my colleagues then share through FIRE's website and social media channels. I also publish news and other information of public concern via "X" (https://x.com/adamsteinbaugh) and "Bluesky" (https://bsky.app/profile/adamsteinbaugh.bsky.social).

The Department has previously granted FIRE expedited processing. See, e.g., FOIA No. 25-F-2201.

2. The requested information concerns an actual or alleged government activity, namely an Executive Order requiring a report to the Secretary of Defense.

3. The requested information extends beyond the public's right to know about government activity generally and instead has a particular value that would be lost if not processed on an expedited basis. The information pertains to a news story of public interest. That issue has attracted a wide range of news media coverage, including the numerous articles identified below. The information has value that would be lost if not processed on an expedited basis because it concerns the Secretary's implementation of a presidential policy priority, and because the public's feedback may impact the final report required of the  Task Force's final report required of the Secretary of Defense to the Deputy Chief of Staff for Policy on or before July 26, 2025. (See Sec. 7(b) of the Executive Order.)  If that information is only disclosed months or years later, it will inhibit the ability of the public to understand how its current officials are making decisions.

Examples of recent articles demonstrating the public's ongoing and current interest in this information include articles:

https://www.cbsnews.com/news/pentagon-intelligence-arm-dia-pausing-dei-mlk-holocaust-remembrance-and-other-observations/
https://www.foxnews.com/politics/trump-signs-executive-orders-banning-radical-gender-ideology-dei-initiatives-military
https://www.washingtontimes.com/news/2025/jan/29/pete-hegseth-creates-new-pentagon-task-force-ban-r/
https://www.washingtonexaminer.com/news/3302523/trump-executive-orders-military-excellence/
https://www.npr.org/2025/01/28/nx-s1-5277155/trump-military-transgender-dei-iron-dome-orders
https://freebeacon.com/latest-news/die-dei-trump-signs-executive-order-banning-woke-program-in-military/
https://www.defenseone.com/policy/2025/01/hegseth-stands-anti-dei-task-force/402623/
https://www.stripes.com/theaters/us/2025-01-30/hegseth-dei-defense-department-promotions-academies-16654199.html
https://www.foxnews.com/politics/trump-dod-creates-task-force-abolish-dei-offices-promote-systemic-racism
https://thehill.com/policy/defense/5129386-west-point-cadet-clubs-ordered-disband/
https://www.stripes.com/branches/air_force/2025-03-20/air-force-base-dei-compliance-visits-17205950.html
https://www.expressnews.com/news/article/dei-hegseth-trump-military-dei-air-force-20230989.php
https://san.com/cc/naval-academy-removes-close-to-400-books-linked-to-dei-following-dod-order/
https://www.fedweek.com/armed-forces-news/dod-task-force-visiting-installations-to-observe-dei-rollback/
https://www.iheart.com/content/2025-02-06-west-point-shuts-down-campus-clubs-related-to-race-gender-amid-dei-attacks/
https://www.campusreform.org/article/hegseth-orders-end-affirmative-action-admissions-service-academies/27419
https://thehill.com/policy/defense/5114409-pence-hegseth-military-promotions-race-sex/

REQUEST FOR A FEE WAIVER OR REDUCED FEES:

I request, under 32 CFR § 286.12(l), a waiver or reduction of fees for the following reasons:

1. Disclosure of the requested information is in the public interest because its disclosure would shed light on the operations or activities of the government. The requested information pertains specifically to the policies, procedures, and practices of senior Department officials concerning the Department's policies and programs.

2. Disclosure of the requested information would be likely to contribute significantly to public understanding of those operations or activities. Disclosure of the requested information would meaningfully inform the public about the Department's activities and operations, as the information pertains to the policies and underlying information driving decisions by senior Department officials. Disclosing the policies and other information would demonstrate the bases for those decisions, which have attracted substantial public attention, as demonstrated by the articles cited above. That information is not in the public domain.

3. Disclosure of the requested information will contribute to the understanding of a reasonably broad audience of persons interested in the subject, as opposed to the individual understanding of the requester. The requestor is a licensed attorney who practices First Amendment law. As such, the requestor will be able to effectively convey information to the public. Further, the requestor is a representative of the news media. The requestor and his employer, the Foundation for Individual Rights and Expression, gather information of potential interest to a segment of the public, turns that information into distinct works (including through its news website, located at https://thefire.org/news), and distributes that information to the public. The information requested here relates to information that is about current events or that would be of current interest to the public. The requestor's past publication record (in addition to FIRE's articles available at https://thefire.org/news) is available at https://www.thefire.org/news-archive?author=303.

4. The requested information is not primarily in the commercial interest of the requester. The requestor works for a nonprofit organization and the records are not sought for a commercial purpose.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

title: NSA Recordings of USS Liberty Attack Made by Marvin Nowicki
tags: israeli attack on the uss liberty

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: NSA Recordings of USS Liberty Attack Made by Marvin Nowicki
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I was aboard the USS Liberty when the IDF attacked our ship on June 8, 1967 and serve my shipmates as Historian of the USS Liberty Veterans Association.

In a letter from retired NSA Analyst Marvin E. Nowicki, Ph.D., and published in The Wall Street Journal, Wednesday, May 16, 2001, page A-23, Mr. Nowicki refers to tapes he and a colleague recorded while aboard a US Navy EC121 while monitoring the events in the Eastern Mediterranean on June 8, 1967.

We are asking for a copy of the recordings referred to by Mr. Nowicki.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joe Meadors

title: Medical Policies for Blood Borne Pathogens (Pinal County Sheriff's Office)

communications.subject: Arizona Public Records Law Request: Medical Policies for Blood Borne Pathogens (Pinal County Sheriff's Office)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Arizona Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

1- Any directives, regulations, manuals, memos, or other training materials given to all staff—both medical and correctional—related to handling or managing prisoners with blood borne pathogens including but not limited Hepatitis C or HIV/AIDS.  This could be in the form of training materials on how to quarantine individuals with blood borne pathogens, or training materials for correctional staff on what to do when coming into contact with someone who has a blood borne pathogen. 

2- Any emergency preparedness manuals, directives, or training materials for when a viral outbreak occurs (this could also be referred to as a “pandemic procedure".)

3- Any medical directives, memos, regulations, or staff training around prescribing the medical protocol of PrEP (pre-exposure prophylaxis).

4- Any directives, regulations, manuals, memos, or other training materials given to staff on housing criteria for specific populations (e.g. women, youth, those with illnesses, etc.)

5- Employee handbook given to correctional staff upon hiring, as well as any employee handbook given separately to medical staff

I am also requesting the following data and forms:

1- Aggregate data by month on the number of prisoners with HIV and Hep C for the last two years. If this data exists only in a format that requires creation of a new record, please provide the data in its original format and remove identifying information.

2- A copy of the standard medical intake form used for prisoners or people held inside the facility.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Joseph Darius Jaafari

communications.subject: [Records Center] Public Records Request :: P020883-040325
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 

Greetings Joseph Jaafari, 
Status for the week of May 14, 2025.   I sent this notice to our Adult Detention Command and I am pending their response.  I sent another email of reminder.  I will continue to assist in expediting as best. 
Advising that your request continues to be processed.  Please note that request for public records are processed in the order they are received and based on limited staff and resources, fulfilling a request often requires a significant amount of time and resources. Before any record can be released, they must be reviewed, redacted to maintain applicable privacy, confidentiality. 
PCSO Records are actively gathering, culling, reviewing and redacting as necessary. 
We can not definitively estimate how long that process will take, we encourage you to stay in touch with PCSO Records for updates and I will continue to diligently expedite as best possible.   And I will keep you posted of status via this GovQA online portal. 
We will continue our diligent efforts to produce documents, on a rolling basis, while simultaneously maintaining operations and other services to which our department and personnel are assigned. 
If you have any questions, please feel to contact our office (520) 866-5193 
Respectfully. 
Andrea Kipp 
Record Manager 
PCSO RECORDS UNIT

communications.subject: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: New Mexico SEA response
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All documentation submitted to the U.S. Department of Education's Student Privacy Policy Office in response to the office's March 28, 2025, request for records such as "'reports, information on policies and procedures, annual notifications, training materials or other information necessary' to provide assurance that the SEA and their respective LEAs are complying with the provisions of FERPA and PPRA".

I have attached a copy of the SPPO's request letter for reference. The relevant section is found on the last page, under "Assurance of Compliance". The SPPO requested the documentation be submitted no later than April 30, 2025. If the New Mexico Department of Education sent communications to the SPPO requesting an extension or declining to submit the documentation, I request a copy of said communications.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ileana Garnand

communications.subject: RE: Michigan Freedom of Information Act Request: Michigan SEA response
communications.communication:
Ms. Garnand,

Your May 1, 2025, emailed request was considered received by MDE on May 2, 2025. FOIA statute MCL 15.235(2) states that a public body shall respond to a request for a record within five business days after it receives the request. The department’s response will be on or before May 9, 2025.

Please let us know if you have any further questions.

Sincerely,

David Head
FOIA Coordinator
Michigan Department of Education
517-855-1139

title: Milwaukee Police Department, Milwaukee, WI Request

communications.subject: Wisconsin Open Records Act Request: Milwaukee Police Department, Milwaukee, WI Request
communications.communication:
To Whom it may concern,
Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:
Any and all records from the past year regarding your nuisance property ordinance that will be referred to as ordinance in this request but could be known (but not limited to) as Chronic Nuisance Premises as described in 80-10 of the city code.
Please provide any and all written records (including but not limited to hard-copy documents, memos, emails, word processor documents, PDF documents, PowerPoint files, images files, video files etc.) regarding the Ordinance including but not limited to:
• police calls, reports, citations, or arrests, collected by the municipality police department for the purpose of enforcing the ordinance
The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.
In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.
Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request.
Sincerely,
Jenny Wadhwa

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I would like to request for the interrogation video of Robert Springsteen  who was interviewed by  the Williamson County Sheriff’s Office.
Additionally, I also ask for Rachel Cooke' crime scene reports from January 10, 2002
and any recordings of 911 calls that are accessible.
as well as any additional case-related investigative materials and photos. Thanks Mahad

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Mahad Mohammed

communications.subject: Records
communications.communication:
Mr. Mohammed,

The Williamson County Sheriff’s Office believes there are exceptions that apply to the records you requested. Your request has been sent to the Open Records Division of the Texas Office of the Attorney General for a determination. Attached is your copy of the letter sent to the TX Attorney General’s Office. You will also be receiving a copy of the AG Brief stating which exceptions we believe apply. The AG’s Office has up to 45 business days to respond to our request for a ruling. Once they issue their ruling, they will provide us a copy and you a copy of their determination. The records will be released or withheld in accordance with that ruling.

Thank you,
Katie Lentz
Open Records

Williamson County Sheriff's Office

508 S. Rock St.

Georgetown, Texas 78626
